item.title: Jacob add a quote by John Kennedy Toole
item.description: "When Fortuna spins you downward, go out to a movie and get more out of life." -- John Kennedy Toole

item.title: Jacob add a quote by Sidney Lumet
item.description: "All good work requires self-revelation." -- Sidney Lumet

item.title: Jacob add a quote by Homer
item.description: "Even a fool learns something once it hits him." -- Homer

item.title: Jacob add a quote by Robert Bresson
item.description: "Hostility to art is also hostility to the new, to the unforeseen." -- Robert Bresson

item.title: Jacob add a quote by László Krasznahorkai
item.description: "...what one ought to capture in beauty is that which is treacherous and irresistible..." -- László Krasznahorkai

item.title: Jacob add a quote by Fyodor Dostoevsky
item.description: "But it is possible, it is possible: the old grief, by a great mystery of human life, gradually passes into quiet, tender joy; instead of young, ebullient blood comes a mild, serene old age: I bless the sun's rising each day and my heart sings to it as before, but now I love its setting even more, its long slanting rays, and with them quiet, mild, tender memories, dear images from the whole of a long and blessed life--and over all is God's truth, moving, reconciling, all-forgiving!" -- Fyodor Dostoevsky

item.title: Jacob add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "When one reads these strange pages of one long gone one feels that one is at one with one who once…" -- James Joyce

item.title: Jacob add a quote by Jerome K. Jerome
item.description: "Idling has always been my strong point." -- Jerome K. Jerome
